pr_title: Fixes #2788 - Graceful close of HTTP/2 Connection.

timeline.message:
Fixes #2788 - Graceful close of HTTP/2 Connection.

Made HTTP2SessionContainer implement Graceful, so that it can be found
in the component hierarchy and can shutdown all sessions.
Modified HTTP2ServerSession to reject requests if already closed/shutdown.
Implemented shutdown in HTTP2Session.

Signed-off-by: Simone Bordet <simone.bordet@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: If the above CAS fails, you're going to return an uncompleted callback.
timeline.author: lorban

replies.bodyText: That is correct. Other threads will complete the callback.
replies.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: Implementors of ISession (HTTP2Session?) don't override equals/hashcode. I'm wary of the side-effects this could have.
timeline.author: lorban

replies.bodyText:
As we discussed, if you protected this sessions collection with a ReentrantReadWriteLock using the read lock to modify the collection and the write lock to shut it down, you could easily guarantee that each session's shutdown method would only ever be called once, and be done with that AtomicBiInteger logic.
This would make this code a ton simpler to maintain in the long run.
replies.author: lorban

replies.bodyText: Not implementing hashCode() and equals() is by design, I really want session objects to be unique. I'll give rwlock a try.
replies.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: The Lo counter might be > 0 when you reach this line, couldn't it?
timeline.author: lorban

timeline.bodyText: This means you may return a CompletableFuture that doesn't block until shutdown is over. Is that desirable?
timeline.author: lorban

replies.bodyText: It returns a CompletableFuture. Whether the caller wants to block on it, or attach a timeout, or attach some other callback it's in the hands of the caller.
replies.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: Don't you have to also call LifeCycle.stop on the session when isShutdown is true?
timeline.author: lorban

replies.bodyText: No, as shutdown will initiate the close, and eventually the connection will be closed, calling onClose() which would remove the session and stop it.
replies.author: sbordet

timeline.bodyText: I would clearly document that this shutdown method has to be idempotent as HTTP2SessionContainer might call it twice, and explain the circumstances under which it can be called twice.
timeline.author: lorban

replies.author: sbordet
